news.headline: Netflix Calendar Spread: A Smart Play on Volatility
news.summary: Netflix (NFLX) stock has been in a severe downtrend for the best part of three months. Netflix streams movies, television shows and documentaries across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is considered a pioneer in the streaming space.
news.article_text:
Netflix (NFLX) stock has been in a severe downtrend for the best part of three months.

Today, we’re looking at a calendar spread on Netflix stock.

Calendar spreads are an option trade that involves selling a short-term option and buying a longer-term option with the same strike.

Traders can use calls or puts and they can be set up to be neutral, bullish or bearish with neutral being the most common.

When doing bullish calendar spreads, we typically use calls to minimize the assignment risk.

news.headline: Netflix Calendar Spread: A Smart Play on Volatility
news.summary: Netflix (NFLX) stock has been in a severe downtrend for the best part of three months. Netflix streams movies, television shows and documentaries across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is considered a pioneer in the streaming space.
news.article_text:
Netflix (NFLX) stock has been in a severe downtrend for the best part of three months.

Today, we’re looking at a calendar spread on Netflix stock.

Calendar spreads are an option trade that involves selling a short-term option and buying a longer-term option with the same strike.

Traders can use calls or puts and they can be set up to be neutral, bullish or bearish with neutral being the most common.

When doing bullish calendar spreads, we typically use calls to minimize the assignment risk.

news.summary: Paramount Skydance wants to push back against Warner Bros. offer to buy all of its cable networks. The company is offering $30 for every share of the network.
news.article_text:
In a dramatic escalation of Hollywood’s latest takeover brawl, Paramount Skydance said Monday it will launch a proxy fight at Warner Bros. Discovery and sue in Delaware to pry loose more details about the company’s pending deal with Netflix—moves aimed at derailing that transaction and advancing its own hostile, all‑cash offer.

Paramount Skydance plans to nominate its own slate of directors for election at Warner Bros. Discovery’s 2026 annual meeting and to urge shareholders to vote against the

news.headline: Paramount Plans Proxy Fight to Push Hostile Warner Bid
news.summary: Paramount Skydance  plans to launch a proxy fight for board seats at  Warner Bros. Discovery  the company said Monday, as it continues pushing its hostile bid for the company.  Paramount also filed a lawsuit seeking to force Warner to release more information about its merger agreement with  Netflix  Paramount has long argued its offer, which Warner repeatedly rebuffed, is superior in value to Netflix’s.  Warner “has provided increasingly novel reasons for avoiding a transaction with Paramount, but what it has never said, because it cannot, is that the Netflix transaction is financially superior to our actual offer,” Paramount said.
